intro: Ixyophora, commonly known as the glasswort, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. These plants are typically found in saline or coastal environments, where they thrive in high-salinity soils. Ixyophora species are often characterized by their succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. They play an important role in stabilizing coastal soils and preventing erosion. Some species are also used in traditional medicine or as ornamental plants.
